column1: Krathum Baen (Thai: กระทุ่มแบน
column2: pronounced [krā.tʰûm bɛ̄ːn]) is a district (amphoe) in the northern part of Samut Sakhon Province

column1: Krathum Baen was a part of Mueang Samut Sakhon District. It was created in 1900. In 1926 the government added Tambons Tha Mai
column4: and Om Noi of Sam Phran District
column5: Nakhon Pathom Province to the district.

column1: Neighbouring districts are (from the north clockwise): Sam Phran of Nakhon Pathom Province; Nong Khaem and  Bang Bon of Bangkok; Mueang Samut Sakhon and Ban Phaeo of Samut Sakhon Province.
The important water resources are the Tha Chin river and Phasi Charoen canal.
The name Krathum Baen meaning 'flat burflower-tree'.
The district is divided into 10 subdistricts (tambons)
column2: which are further subdivided into 76 villages (mubans). There is a city (thesaban nakhon)
column5: Krathum Baen. The non-municipal area is administered by eight tambon administrative organizations (TAO).
